item.source: Dallas Maveriks beat The Miami Heat

item.title: Dallas Maveriks beat The Miami Heat
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

the elve age:

They need to make the finals a 3 game series, that way people might actually care, about the 2nd and 3rd games.

A 3 game series would hardly prove anything. With a 3 game series there is the possibility that the ‘luckier’ team will prevail, which is bad for the sport and would probably kill ratings. I mean just imagine if a team like the Wizards were to play Miami in a 3 game series, all it would take is 1 good game and a lucky shot in the second game for the wizards to win (when clearly the Heat are the better team in this situation.) To prevent luck from prevailing over skill a 7 game series is used.

The idea is that a team might get lucky once or twice but not 3 or 4 times, thereby allowing the better team to move forward, which is what the fans want to see.

Read full topic

item.source: Dallas Maveriks beat The Miami Heat

item.title: Dallas Maveriks beat The Miami Heat
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

I love Lebron and the Heat. I’ve been pulling for Lebron since day one, I went and saw him play against detroit earlier this year, it was a blast.

I wish they would have one the championship this year but barring any injuries or blockbuster trades by any other eastern conference team I can guarantee that they will be back in the Finals again next year.

Aside from my love of the Heat, I’m pretty happy that J Kidd, Terry, and Dirk got their first rings. Jason Kidd especially since he led two previous teams to the finals and lost (the Nets, back to back.) Now that Kidd has his championship ring he is one of the top point guards of all time, without the “but he never won a ring argument” alot of his doubters are silenced.

PS: I love basketball

Read full topic

  • Thunder
  • Bulls
  • Knicks

Only knicks because of their recent trades ;), and i think clippers may make it to the play-offs this year cause of that beast Black Griffin <3[/quote]Nah, Knicks still aint gonnt make it probably. Heat and Bulls most likely. I don’t watch many thunder games.
